cleaned_text: In recent years there has been a lot of discussion about vaccinations causing Autism Spectrum Disorder, or ASD, which has decreased the amount of children receiving vaccines because of cautious and reluctant parents. I have chosen this topic because of my interest in Autism and because I was curious as to what facts could possibly back up linking vaccinations to Autism. I also have chosen this topic because it aggravates me that parents are willing to put their children at risk of deadly diseases all because they are scared to have an Autistic child. Vaccinations, specifically the MMR (measles, mumps and rubella) vaccine, do not cause Autism Spectrum Disorder and it is unfair to have young children vulnerable to diseases and unable to decide for themselves whether they want to vaccine or not. I believe that vaccines are not causing Autism and that all children should receive their vaccinations to ensure they live their life as healthy as possible. Autism Spectrum Disorder is defined as a "complex neurobiological disorder that impacts normal brain development leaving most individuals with communication problems, difficulty with typical social interactions and a tendency to repeat specific patterns of behaviour. ()" For people suffering with ASD they also experience it affecting their gastrointestinal, immune, hepatic and endocrine and nervous systems. Recent studies done by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention show that 1 in 68 children are diagnosed with ASD and statistics taken by the Government of Canada showed that almost 90% of all children received the MMR vaccine in 2013 before the age of two.It is believed that thimerosal, which is included in other vaccines as a preservative, is one of the main risks for ASD onset. The use of mercury in the thimerosal is one of the main arguments parents of autistic children have against vaccines.
